BURGOS (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CISTERCIAN MONASTERY OF LAS HUELGAS (Burgos, Monasterio de Santa Maria la Real de las Huelgas, Calle de Compases de Huelgas):

Queen BERENGARIA I OF CASTILE (+1246), consort of King Alfonso IX of LeÃ³n

BURGOS (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CHURCH OF ST STEPHEN

(Burgos, Iglesia de San Esteban, Calle San Esteban):

Queen URRACA DE HARO (+c. 1226), consort of King Ferdinand II of LeÃ³n.

Earlier buried in the Royal Monastery of St Mary at VileÃ±a. Following the destruction of the monastery by fire in 1970, the tomb of Queen Urraca was moved to the Church of St Stephen in Burgos. In VileÃ±a only ruins of the monastery have survived.

CANGAS DE ONIS (SPAIN)

The tomb has not been preserved.

02. Queen FROILUBA, consort of King Favila.

LORVÃO (PORTUGAL)

OÃA (SPAIN)

PRAVIA-SANTIANES (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CHURCH OF ST JOHN THE EVANGELIST

SAHAGÃN (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE THE BENEDICTINE MONASTERY OF THE HOLY CROSS (SahagÃºn, Monasterio de las Benedictinas de Santa Cruz, Av. de Doctores Bermejo y CalderÃ³n):

SAN JUAN DE LA PEÃA (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE OLD ROYAL MONASTERY (Real Monasterio de San Juan de la PeÃ±a, Monasterio Viejo-PanteÃ³n Real):

SAN MARTIN DEL REY AURELIO (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CHURCH OF ST MARTIN

(San MartÃ­n del Rey Aurelio, Iglesia de San MartÃ­n de Tours):

King AURELIO OF ASTURIAS (+774).

A new church was built in 1945 on site of the original church which had been destroyed during the war. The royal tomb has not been preserved and the burial place of King Aurelio is disputed by historians.

SANTIAGO DE COMPOSTELA (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CATHEDRAL OF ST JAMES

(Catedral de Santiago de Compostela, Plaza de PlaterÃ­as):

01. Queen BERENGUELA OF BARCELONA (+1149), consort of King Alfonso VII of Castile

02. King FERDINAND II OF LEÃN (+1188)

03. King ALFONSO IX OF LEÃN (+1230), consort of Queen Berenguela I of Castile

TOLEDO (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CATHEDRAL OF ST MARY (La catedral de Santa Maria de Toledo, Calle del Cardenal Cisneros):

King ALFONSO VII THE EMPEROR (+1157)

WAMBA (SPAIN)

BURIED IN THE CHURCH OF ST MARY

(Wamba, Iglesia de Santa MarÃ­a, Calle de la Iglesia):

Queen URRACA OF PORTUGAL (+1188), consort of King Ferdinand II of LeÃ³n.

The tomb has not been preserved.

LIST OF SOVEREIGNS OF ASTURIAS-LEÃN 718-1230

KINGDOM OF ASTURIAS 718-910:

PELAYEZ DYNASTY (DinastÃ­a de Pelayo)

718-737: PELAGIUS (Don Pelayo)

Born in ?

Father: Duke Favila of Cantabria.

Married GAUDIOSA.

His issue who reigned:

-FAVILA (+739),

-Ermesinda (Queen of Asturias).

Died in 737.

Buried with his Queen Gaudiosa in the Santa Cueva of Covadonga.

737-739: FAVILA

Born in ?

Father: King Pelagius of Asturias. Mother: Queen Gaudiosa.

Married FROILUBA.

Died in 739.

Buried with his Queen Froiliuba in the Church of the Holy Cross at Cangas de Onis (no tombs).

PEREZ DYNASTY (DinastÃ­a astur-leonesa)

739-757: ALFONSO I THE CATHOLIC (Alfonso I el CatÃ³lico)

Born in 693.

Father: Duke Pedro of Cantabria.

Married Princess ERMESINDA of Asturias.

His issue who reigned:

-FRUELA I (*c. 740,+768),

-Adosinda (+785; Queen of Asturias).

-MAUREGATUS (+789; illegitimate).

Died in 757.

Firstly buried with his Queen Ermesinda in the Church of St Eulalia in Abamia. In the 13th c. translated to the Sanctuary of Santa Cueva in Covadonga.

757-768: FRUELA I

Born in c. 740.

Father: King Alfonso I of Asturias. Mother: Queen Ermesinda of Asturias.

Married MUNIA.

His issue who reigned:

-ALFONSO II (*c. 765,+842).

Died in 768 at Cangas de Onis.

Buried with his Queen Munia in Oviedo Cathedral.

768-774: AURELIO

Born in ?

Father: Duke Fruela of Cantabria.

Died in 774 at San Martin del Rey Aurelio.

Buried in the Church of St Martin at San MartÃ­n del Rey Aurelio near Langreo (uncertain; destroyed).

774-783: SILO (not a member of the dynasty)

Born in ?

Married Princess ADOSINDA of Asturias (+785).

Died in 783 at Pravia.

Buried with his Queen Adosinda in the Church of St John at Pravia-Santianes (no tombs).

783-789: MAUREGATUS (Mauregato)

Born in ?

Father: King Alfonso I of Asturias. Mother: unknown.

Died in 789.

Buried in the Church of St John at Pravia-Santianes (no tomb).

789-791: BERMUDO I THE DEACON (Bermudo I el DiÃ¡cono)

Born in c. 750.

Father: Duke Fruela of Cantabria.

Married UZENDA.

His issue who reigned:

-RAMIRO I (*c. 790,+850).

Abdicated in 791.

Died in 797.

Buried with his Queen Uzenda in the Monastery of St John of Corias near Cangas del Narcea.

791-842: ALFONSO II THE CHASTE (Alfonso II el Casto)

Born in c. 765.

Father: King Fruela I of Asturias. Mother: Queen Munia.

Married BERTHA.

Died in 842.

Buried in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

842-850: RAMIRO I

Born in c. 790.

Father: King Bermudo I of Asturias. Mother: Queen Uzenda.

Married secondly in 842 PATERNA of Castile.

His issue who reigned:

-ORDOÃO I (*c. 830,+866).

Died in 850 at LiÃ±o.

Buried in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

850-866: ORDOÃO I

Born in c. 830 in Oviedo.

Father: King Ramiro I of Asturias.

Married MUNIA.

His issue who reigned:

-ALFONSO III (*848,+910).

Died in 866 in Oviedo.

Buried with his Queen Munia in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

866-910: ALFONSO III THE GREAT (Alfonso III el Magno)

Born in 848.

Father: King OrdoÃ±o I of Asturias. Mother: Queen Munia.

Married in c. 869 JIMENA of Navarre (+912).

His issue who reigned:

-GARCIA I (*c. 871,+914),

-ORDOÃO II (*c. 873,+924),

-FRUELA II (*c. 875,+925).

Died in 910 in Zamora.

Buried with his Queen Jimena in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

KINGDOM OF LEÃN 910-1230:

PEREZ DYNASTY (DinastÃ­a astur-leonesa)

910-914: GARCIA I

Born in c. 871.

Father: King Alfonso III of Asturias. Mother: Queen Jimena of Navarre.

Married MUNIA of Amaya.

Died in 914 in Zamora.

Buried in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

914-924: ORDOÃO II

Born in c. 873.

Father: King Alfonso III of Asturias. Mother: Queen Jimena of Navarre.

Married firstly c. 890/900 ELVIRA (+921).

Married secondly in 922 ARAGONTA Betotez. Reoudiated in 922.

Married thirdly in 923 Princess SANCHA of Navarre (+959).

He was crowned in 914 in LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-ALFONSO IV (*c. 899,+c. 933; son of Elvira),

-RAMIRO II (*c. 900,+951; son of Elvira).

Died in 924 in LeÃ³n.

Buried in the Cathedral of LeÃ³n.

His first consort Queen Elvira was buried in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

His third consort Queen Sancha of Navarre was firstly buried in the monastery of San Pedro de Arlanza in HortigÃ¼ela. In 1841 she was translated to the Collegiate of Covarrubias.

924-925: FRUELA II

Born in c. 875.

Father: King Alfonso III of Asturias. Mother: Queen Jimena of Navarre.

Married firstly before 911 Nunilo Ximena.

Married secondly URRACA of Toledo.

Died in 925.

Buried in the Cathedral of Oviedo.

925-931: ALFONSO IV THE MONK (Alfonso IV el Monje)

Born in c. 899.

Father: King OrdoÃ±o II of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Elvira.

Married in 923 Princess ONECA of Navarre (+931).

His issue who reigned:

-ORDOÃO IV (*c. 926,+962).

Abdicated in 931.

Died in c. 933 in the Monastery of S. JuliÃ¡n de Reforco.

Buried with his Queen Oneca, firstly in the Monastery of S. JuliÃ¡n de Reforco, later translated to St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tombs).

931-951: RAMIRO II THE FEROCIOUS WARRIOR

(Ramiro II el Feroz Guerrero)

Born in c. 900.

Father: King OrdoÃ±o II of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Elvira.

Married firstly c. 925 Adosinda Osorez. Repudiated in 930.

Married secondly in c. 932 Princess URRACA of Navarre (+956).

He was crowned in 931 in LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-Theresa (Queen of Navarre; daughter of Adosinda),

-ORDOÃO III (*c. 926,+956; son of Adosinda),

-SANCHO I (*933,+966; son of Urraca).

Abdicated in 951.

Died in 951.

Buried in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

His Queen Urraca of Navarre was buried in Oviedo Cathedral.

951-956: ORDOÃO III

Born in c. 925.

Father: King Ramiro II of LeÃ³n. Mother: Princess Adosinda.

Married in 941 URRACA of Castile (+after 1006).

He was crowned in 951 in LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-BERMUDO II (*c. 953,+999; illegitimate).

Died in 956 at Zamora.

Buried in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

His Queen Urraca of Castile was buried in the Monastery of San Juan de la PeÃ±a.

956-958 and 960-966: SANCHO I THE FAT (Sancho I el Gordo)

Born in 933.

Father: King Ramiro II of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Urraca of Navarre.

Married in 960 THERESA AnsÃºrez (+after 997).

He was crowned in 956 in the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela.

His issue who reigned:

-RAMIRO III (*961,+985).

Deposed in 958 and exiled in Navarra. Restored in 960.

Died in 966 (poisoned).

Buried in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

His Queen Theresa was buried in Oviedo Cathedral.

958-960: ORDOÃO IV THE BAD (OrdoÃ±o IV el Malo)

Born in c. 926.

Father: King Alfonso IV of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Oneca of Navarre.

Married in 958 Dowager Queen of LeÃ³n URRACA of Castile (+after 1006).

He was crowned in 958 in the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela.

Deposed in 960 and exiled in the Caliphate of CordÃ³ba.

Died in c. 962 at CÃ³rdoba.

Buried in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

His Queen Urraca of Castile was buried in the Monastery of San Juan de la PeÃ±a.

966-985: RAMIRO III THE CHILD (Ramiro III el NiÃ±o)

Born in 961.

Father: King Sancho I of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Theresa.

Married before 979 SANCHA de SaldaÃ±a (+after 983).

Deposed in 985.

Died in 985 in Astorga.

Buried with his Queen Sancha, firstly in the Monastery of S. Miguel at Destriana, later translated to St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

985-999: BERMUDO II THE GOUTY (Bermudo II el Gotoso)

Born in c. 953.

Father: King OrdoÃ±o III of LeÃ³n. Mother: Aragonta Palaez (?).

Married firstly in 981 VELASQUITA (+after 1024). Repudiated in 988.

Married secondly in 991 ELVIRA of Castile (+1017).

He was crowned in 985 in the Cathedral of LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-ALFONSO V (*996,+1028; son of Elvira).

Died in 999 in Villabuena del Bierzo.

Buried firstly in the Monastery of Carracedo, later reburied with his second consort Queen Elvira in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

999-1028: ALFONSO V THE NOBLE (Alfonso V el Noble)

Born in 996.

Father: King Bermudo II of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Elvira of Castile.

Married firstly in 1013 ELVIRA MenÃ©dez (+1022).

Married secondly in 1023 Princess URRACA of Navarre.

He was crowned in 999 in the Cathedral of LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-Sancha (*1013,+1067; Queen of Castile; daughter of Elvira),

-BERMUDO III (*1017,+1037; son of Elvira).

Killed in 1028 during the Siege of Viseu in Portugal.

Buried with his first consort Queen Elvira in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

1028-1037: BERMUDO III

Born in 1017.

Father: King Alfonso V of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Elvira.

Married in 1036 JIMENA of Castile (*1012,+after 1063 Vega).

Killed in the Battle of TamarÃ³n in 1037.

Buried with his Queen Jimena of Castile in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

HOUSE OF NAVARRE (Casa de Navarra)

1037-1065: FERDINAND I (Fernando I; King of Castile)

Born in 1017.

Father: King Sancho III of Navarre. Mother: Queen Munia Mayor.

Married in 1032 Princess SANCHA of LeÃ³n (*1013,+1067).

He was crowned in 1038 in the Cathedral of LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-SANCHO II (*1036/38,+1072),

-ALFONSO VI (*c. 1040,+1109).

Died in 1065 in LeÃ³n.

Buried with his Queen Sancha of LeÃ³n in St Isidore's Basilica in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

1065-1071 and 1072-1109: ALFONSO VI THE BRAVE

(Alfonso VI el Valiente; King of Castile)

Born in c. 1040.

Father: King Ferdinand I of Castile. Mother: Queen Sancha of LeÃ³n.

Married firstly in 1074 AGNES of Aquitaine (*1052,+1078).

Married secondly in 1080 CONSTANCE of Burgundy (*1046,+1092).

Married thirdly in 1092 BERTHA of Burgundy (+1098).

Married fourthly in 1098/99 ISABELLA (+1107).

Married fifthly in c. 1108 BEATRICE [of Acquitaine?].

He was crowned in 1066 in St Mary's Cathedral in LeÃ³n.

His issue who reigned:

-URRACA (*1081,+1126; daughter of Constance),

-Elvira (*c. 1110,+1135; Queen of Sicily; daughter of Isabella).

Deposed in 1071 and exiled in Toledo. Restored in 1072.

Died in 1109.

Firstly buried with his four queens, Agnes, Constance, Bertha and Isabella, in SahagÃºn Monastery, later reburied in the Benedictine Monastery of the Holy Cross in SahagÃºn. The burial place of his fifth consort, Queen Beatrice, remains unknown.

1071-1072: SANCHO II (King of Castile)

Born in 1036/38.

Father: King Ferdinand I of Castile. Mother: Queen Sancha of LeÃ³n.

Married in c. 1071 ALBERTA (?)

Died in 1072 (murdered).

Buried in San Salvador's Monastery at OÃ±a.

1109-1126: URRACA (Queen of Castile)

Born in 1081.

Father: King Alfonso VI of Castile. Mother: Queen Constance of Burgundy.

Married firstly in 1090 in Toledo Count Raymond of Burgundy (+1107 Grajal).

Married secondly in 1109 in Burgos King ALFONSO I of Aragon (*1073,+1134 near Alumiente). Marriage was annulled in 1114.

Her issue who reigned:

-ALFONSO VII (*1105,+1157; son of Raymond).

Died in 1126 at SaldaÃ±a.

Buried in the Basilica of St Isidore in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

Her first consort Count Raymond of Burgundy was buried in the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela.

Her second consort King Alfonso I of Aragon was buried in the Church of San Pedro el Viejo at Huesca.

HOUSE OF BURGUNDY (Casa de BorgoÃ±a)

1126-1157: ALFONSO VII THE EMPEROR (Alfonso VII el Emperador; King of Castile)

Born in 1105.

Father: Count Raymond of Burgundy. Mother: Queen Urraca of Castile.

Married firstly in 1128 at SaldaÃ±a BERENGUELA of Barcelona (*1116,+1149 Palencia).

Married secondly in 1152 Princess RYCHEZA of Poland (*1130/40,+1185; burial place unknown).

He was crowned in 1126 in Santiago de Compostela.

He was crowned in 1135 in the Cathedral of LeÃ³n as the Emperor of Spain.

His issue who reigned:

-Sancho III (*1134,+1158; King of Castile; son of Berenguela),

-FERDINAND II (*1137,+1188; son of Berenguela),

-Sancha (*1137,+1179; Queen of Navarra; daughter of Berenguela),

-Constance (*1141,+1160; Queen of France; daughter of Berenguela),

-Sancha (*1155/57,+1208; Queen of Aragon; daughter of Rycheza).

Died in 1157 at Fresneda.

Buried in the Cathedral of Toledo.

His first consort Queen Berenguela of Barcelona was buried in the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela.

1157-1188: FERDINAND II (Fernando II)

Born in 1137.

Father: King Alfonso VII of Castile-LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Berenguela of Barcelona.

Married firstly in 1165 Princess URRACA of Portugal (*c. 1150,+1188). Marriage was annulled in 1175.

Married secondly in c. 1178 THERESA Perez de Lara (+1180 LeÃ³n).

Married thirdly in 1187 in LeÃ³n URRACA LÃ³pez de Haro (+c. 1226 VileÃ±a).

His issue who reigned:

-ALFONSO IX (*1171,+1230; son of Urraca of Portugal).

Died in 1188 at Benavente.

Buried in the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela.

His first consort Queen Urraca of Portugal was buried in the Convent of Wamba (no tomb).

His second consort Queen Theresa was buried in the Basilica of St Isidore in LeÃ³n (no tomb).

His third consort Queen Urraca de Haro was buried in the Royal Monastery of St Mary at VileÃ±a (the tomb was moved to the Church of St Stephen in Burgos after 1970) .

1188-1230: ALFONSO IX

Born in 1171 at Zamora.

Father: King Ferdinand II of LeÃ³n. Mother: Queen Urraca of Portugal.

Married firstly in 1191 at Guimaraes Princess THERESA of Portugal (*c. 1176 Coimbra,+1250 LorvÃ£o).

Marriage was annulled in 1198.

Married secondly in 1197 in Valladolid Princess BERENGARIA of Castile (later Queen Berengaria I of Castile; *1180,+1246 Las Huelgas). Marriage was annulled in 1202.

His issue who reigned:

-FERDINAND III (*1201,+1252; son of Berenguela).

Died in 1230 at Villanueva de Sarria.

Buried in the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela.

His first consort Queen Theresa of Portugal was buried in the Monastery of LorvÃ£o, Portugal.

His second consort Queen Berengaria of Castile was buried in the Monastery of Las Huelgas near Burgos.
